Good Morning Pirate Nation,
Earlier this week the University Interscholastic League (UIL), issued a stern warning to all districts failing to meet compliance with preventative expectations due to COVID-19. To ensure that our student-athletes are not penalized due our failure to enforce these guidelines, we want to ensure that all spectators are aware and have access to the Chilton ISD expectations regarding fan attendance during our sporting events. Please understand the following:
1. All events will require a ticket.
2. Egress and regress will not be permitted.
3. Temperature screenings will be mandated.
4. Entry will be denied if a face covering is not worn.
5. All seating will be marked. Please only sit where there is no blue tape.
For a more comprehensive list of expectations, please follow the link below:
https://core-docs.s3.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/906136/Athletic_Guidelines.pdf

For information that helps explain our mask expectation, please follow the link below: https://aatishb.com/maskmath/

Thanks for your assistance in these matters.

We are working to develop a comprehensive plan for school reopening. We anticipate the release of our reopening plan on Tuesday, July 14, 2020. Thank you for your continued patience and support.

As an additional precaution, we will be suspending strength and conditioning workouts through July 13, 2020. Though we have had no positive results for COVID 19 as a result of our workouts, we are suspending our workouts in an abundance of caution given the current rise in cases in the Centeal Texas area. We are tremendously enthused by the hard work and commitment of our student-athletes, but we want to continue to evaluate our practices to ensure we are taking every measure to keep our students safe. If you have any questions concerning workouts, please contact Coach James.

Be responsible and stay safe!

Wednesday Activity:
Can you solve these Mathematics Brain Teasers?

The Merchant
A merchant can place 8 large boxes or 10 small boxes into a carton for shipping. In one shipment, he sent a total of 96 boxes. If there are more large boxes than small boxes, how many cartons did he ship?

How can you add eight 8’s to get the number 1,000 (only use addition)?

Once you solve the riddle, please take a picture of your work and send it to Mr. Hubbard. After you are finished, find a riddle of your own and post to social media to have others solve.

#ChallengeSupportGrow

Mindset Thought For Today:

Adversity is a catalyst for creativity. It is the breeding ground of personal growth. When we interviewed men and women of success and happiness, they always pointed to times of great adversity; when they built the skills, developed the Mindsets, or forged the relationships that ultimately defined their success. How can we take this time of uncertainty, fear, and challenge; and use it as a building block for a better life and a better world?

#MindsetMatters

Kevin Carrizales
Kevin has enlisted in the Marine Corps, and will begin bootcamp shortly after graduation. His favorite class in high school was Art. He cherishes all of the memories that he made going to regionals in track every year. He also appreciated the time that he was able to be there for his close friends and enjoy life together with his classmates. Kevin wants to tell underclassman to enjoy the time that they have left, because high school is a thing that happens once in a lifetime. Be there for each other and be kind to others. If you’re in a tough situation in life or going through a lot of things, never give up! Pick yourself up and push yourself through it. He reminds you that you’re not alone and you can always reach out to him, your parents, and most importantly, God. Keep your heads up and finish strong (in school, athletics, work, and life)!
Congrats, Kevin! Your Pirate Legacy will not be forgotten!
#CP4L
